member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.ClientSideEvents
member.summary: Object that keeps the list of names for event function handlers used by JavaScript on client side.
member.remarks:
Because of the stateless nature of web connections, and the typical delays involved in returning information from the server, WebMenu implements both client-side events and server-side events. You can choose whether you would like to respond to client-side events, which must be implemented through JavaScript. The ClientSideEvent object maintains a list of event handlers that are implemented on the client and called in response to events as they occur in the browser. Each event is a string that represents JavaScript function name. The named function must be implemented by the developer in JavaScript code.
Every event function handler should have 3 parameters (the InitializeTabs has only 1 parameter). The first parameter contains reference to the JavaScript object that represents UltraWebTab.
The second parameter contains reference to the JavaScript object that represents Tab.
The third parameter contains reference to the JavaScript object that represents Event.
Look at the events description for details.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.ContentPane
member.summary: The ContentPane object handles context displayed in the UltraWebTab when a particular object is selected.

ul.li: It can display the which is rendered as the <IFRAME> html element, or it may have explicit child controls that are placed within the <DIV> html element and are rendered using the standard logic of the .NET.

Child controls can be constructed and added to the or to the Controls from code at run time, or they can be built at design time using the templates: right-mouse-click on the UltraWebTab and select "Edit Template" option.
If the TargetUrl is not set, then the child controls are rendered automatically.
The background color of the ContentPane is defined by the BackColor of the .

The ContentPane may have optional border. If none of properties related to border is set and ContentPane has TargetUrl, then' the default border of the <IFRAME> html element is used. Border properties are applied for both modes: TargetUrl and child controls.

member.summary: Behavior of scroll bars that are used for the container of child controls.

remarks.p:
Notes:
If scrollbars are enabled, then they work better when is enabled.
If is disabled, then the size of UltraWebTab may depend on the size of ContentPane and there can be nothing to scroll.
That property is used to set the value of the OVERFLOW attribute of the DIV html element that represents the ContentPane.
The value of Visible is the browser-default for the OVERFLOW and ContentPane should be fully visible (depends on a particular browser).

summary.p: Returns the collection of child controls that will be displayed within the .

remarks.p: The Children collection contains all of the child controls that will be displayed when a particular tab is selected. There are currently two ways in which child controls can be added to the Children collection, at Design-Time using Template Editor and at Run-Time from code.
To add controls at run-time: Add the UltraWebTab control to an aspx page. Add code similar to the following to create and add your control to the ContentPane of a Tab object.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.TabOrientation
member.summary: Used with the TabOrientation property of the UltraWebTab object.

remarks.p: The TabOrientation enumerations are comprised of the tab orientation and the alignment of the tabs, respectively. Eg. The enum TopLeft will render the tab objects to render along the top of the content area and aligned to the left side of the control.

summary.p: Tabs are rendered across the top of the control, aligned to the left side.
Tabs are rendered across the top of the control, aligned to the right side.
Tabs are rendered across the bottom of the control, aligned to the left side.
Tabs are rendered across the bottom of the control, aligned to the right side.
Tabs are rendered down the left side of the control, aligned to the top.
Tabs are rendered down the left side of the control, aligned to the bottom.
Tabs are rendered down the right side of the control, aligned to the top.
Tabs are rendered down the right side of the control, aligned to the bottom.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.TextOrientation
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of text rendered in the tab objects.

remarks.p: Permitted values are Horizontal and Vertical.

In all Netscape browsers and browsers prior to version 6.0 Vertical text indicates that the text will be rendered such that each letter is on a new line from top to bottom. On IE6 the text will be rotated 90 degrees clockwise.

summary.p: Specifies the style to render RoundedImage.
Image can not be stretched and it is used as it is. While rendering, a tab is subdivided on 2-3 parts and every part is painted separately using different parts of provided image.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.RoundedImageStyle.None
member.summary:
Rounded images are not used.
Tabs are painted using the BackColor and border related subproperties of the Tab's Style properties.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.RoundedImageStyle.LeftRightOnly
member.summary:
The border is not painted and the background of the center part of tab is filled by the BackColor of Style properties.
Tab is devided on 3 parts. To render the left side of tab,- the left part of image is used. To render the right side of tab,- the right part of image is used. Image is not used to fill center part of tab, and an application should provide the background color(s) within the DefaultTabStyle (and HoverTabStyle, SelectedTabStyle and DisabledTabStyle in case of different images) property of UltraWebTab.
Notes:
The values of BackColor in Style properties of tabs should match with the background color of images that are used to draw rounded edges.
This style allows to uses image(s) with the smallest possible size(s), because the only edges of image are used, however, the center parts of tabs are painted flat.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.RoundedImageStyle.LeftMergedWithCenter
member.summary:
The border and background are not painted.
Tab is devided on 2 parts. To render the left side of tab and its center,- the left part of image is used. To render the right side of tab,- the right part of image is used. The background color is not used.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.RoundedImageStyle.RightMergedWithCenter
member.summary:
The border and background are not painted.
Tab is devided on 2 parts. To render the right side of tab and its center,- the right part of image is used. To render the left side of tab,- the left part of image is used. The background color is not used.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.RoundedImage
member.summary: Container of properties that define rounded shape for UltraWebTab tabs.

ul.li: To enable rounded images the property should be used.
When rounded images are enabled, then outter border around tabs is not painted and background is not filled by the BackColor. However, the BackColor is used to fill background of ContentPane.
If the property is not set, then default images are used.
The width/height of images should be larger than the width/height of the largest tab.

The UltraWebTab may use a single (custom) image for all styles. To customize rounded images for other states of tab such as mouse-over, selected and disabled, corresponding image-properties should be set as well.

Not all configurations of TabOrientation and TextOrientation are supported for a particular browser,- due to limitation of browsers to properly align background image. In this case,- normal borders and background colors will be used automatically instead of rounded images.

To support down level browsers such as Netscape 4/5:
In addition to the Normal/Selected image properties, the and/or should be set as well.
In case of the bottom (or right) tab orientation,- the height (width) of images should match with the height (width) of tabs.

member.summary:
The name of the file that contains the right edge of a rounded image which is used for a tab in the selected state.
That property is used only for a down level browser such as Netscape 4/5.
If that property is not set, then the default file-image is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.RoundedImage.LeftSideWidth
member.summary: The width in pixels of the part of the rounded image displayed on the left side of tab. Default value is set to 5 pixels.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.RoundedImage.RightSideWidth
member.summary: The width in pixels of the part of the rounded image displayed on the right side of tab. Default value is set to 5 pixels.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.RoundedImage.ShiftOfImages
member.summary:
The shift in pixels of all rounded images besides the image for the selected state. Default value is set to 0 pixels.
This property has effect only if all following conditions are true:
Browser is up-level
UltraWebTab has top or left tab orientation
The value of the FillStyle property is LeftMergedWithCenter or RightMergedWithCenter
In case of the top-tab orientations,- the images are shifted down, in case of the left-tab orientations,- the images are shifted to the right.

Image can not be stretched and it is used as it is.

member.summary: Automatically adjust appearance of buttons to match with appearance of button elements used by a particular browser on the client.

remarks.p: Default value is true.

Note: If any appearance related property is set, then those values are not affected and they have priority over corresponding "automatic" defaults.
At the time the ScrollButtons support only 3 types of predifined styles:
Internet Explorer under WindowsXP blue.
Internet Explorer under Windows2000.
Netscape Navigator.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.ScrollButtons.Delay
member.summary: The delay in milliseconds between scroll events while button is pressed.

remarks.p: Default value is set to 300.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.ScrollButtons.Visibility
member.summary: The location of scroll buttons.

remarks.p: If that property is set to the value other than None, then scroll buttons appear regardless of the number of tabs.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.ScrollButtons.VerticalAlign
member.summary: The vertical alignment of scroll buttons.

remarks.p: That property gives visual effect, when the Height of the property is set.

If the Height is not set, then 100% is used. However, the Netscape Navigator may fail to render button the whole height of tabs and, therefore, it is recommended to set a particular value to the Height.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.ScrollButtons.ShowPartialTabs
member.summary: Show or hide partially visible tabs that appear on the right side of UltraWebTab.

remarks.p: Note: If a particular browser does not allow to process resizing events, then the value of false for that property may lead to misbehavior.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.ScrollButtons.AllowScrollToLastTab
member.summary: Allow scrolling to the very last tab on the right.

remarks.p: Default value is false.
Note: If a particular browser does not allow to process resizing events, then the value of false for that property may lead to misbehavior.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.ScrollButtons.OuterBorderColor
member.summary: Color of the outer border around a scroll button.

remarks.p: Border is solid and 1 pixel wide. If color is empty, then no outer border is rendered.

member.summary: Copies all properties from the ScrollButton object. No merging.

member.summary: Checks if ScrollButton has any property with not a default value.
member.returns: True: all properties have default values.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.ScrollButton.Image
member.summary: The name of the url that contains image used for a button in the normal state.

remarks.p:
Notes:
If string is empty and is true, then default images are used.
If the length of string is less than 5, or it does not contain the "." character surrounded by letters or digits, then that property is rendered as explicit text string, rather than as image.
If this property is not set, then the < character is used as text that appears on the left button, and the > character is used for the right button.
In order to disable that automatic text,- the " " (empty space character) or the " " should be used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.ScrollButton.HoverImage
member.summary: The name of the url that contains image used for a button in the "mouse-over" state.

remarks.p:
Notes:
If the Image property is not set to an image, then this property has no effect.
If that property is not set, then the Image property is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.ScrollButton.PressedImage
member.summary: The name of the url that contains image used for a button in the selected state.

remarks.p:
Notes:
If the Image property is not set to an image, then this property has no effect.
If that property is not set, then the Image property is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.ScrollButton.DisabledImage
member.summary: The name of the url that contains image used for a button in the disabled state.

remarks.p:
Notes:
If the Image property is not set to an image, then this property has no effect.
If that property is not set, then the Image property is used.

member.summary: Stretch image to the size of button or keep original size of image.

member.summary: The locations where the more-tabs buttons can appear.

remarks.p: If that property is set to the value other than None, then the "more-tabs" buttons at run time appear dynamically only they are needed.
The "more-tabs" buttons process mouse-down events and scroll tabs.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.Tab
member.summary: The Tab object represents a selectable item in the Tab control that will change the contents displayed depending on the settings of the ContentPane object.

ul.li: The Tab may be painted by 4 different styles depending on the instant state of a tab: normal, mouse-over, selected, disabled.
Every state of tab may have different image.

The of a tab may have the which is rendered as the <IFRAME> html element. Or it may have explicit child controls that are placed within the <DIV> html element and are rendered using the standard logic of the .NET.
If the TargetUrl is not set, then the child controls are rendered automatically.
Some of the Tab properties can be modified on the client using the JavaScript functionality and persist values between sessions.
The subproperties of the are merged with the and the UltraWebTab.ControlStyle.
The subproperties of the are merged with the , , , and UltraWebTab.ControlStyle
The subproperties of the are merged with the , , , and UltraWebTab.ControlStyle

The subproperties of the are merged with the , , , and UltraWebTab.ControlStyle.
If ForeColor is not set, then the Gray color is used automatically.

The background of the is painted by the SelectedStyle.BackColor color.
In order to paint the background of a tab by different color than the background of the ContentPane,- the CustomRules can be used.

member.summary: String of text that is displayed by the object.

remarks.p:
If string contains the ' ' characters and the RoundedImages () are enabled, then to prevent possible increased height due to soft-line breaks, those characters should be replaced by the " ". In order to ensure multi-lined text, the "
" tag can be used.

member.summary: Alignment of image relative to text.

remarks.p: Not all browsers may support that property.
Any value valid for "" property can be used. For example, absbottom absmiddle baseline bottom left middle right texttop top Default value is left

member.summary: Show or hide this tab item.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.TabItem.NextRow
member.summary: Flag to move this TabItem and all following items in the collection to the next row.

remarks.p:
Notes:
That property has effect only if is set to the MultiRow and the orientation of tabs is horizontal.
If the BackColor property of UltraWebTab is set, then its value is used as the background color behind all tabs accept tabs in the last (outer) row.
If this property is set to true for this TabItem and this is instance of TabSeparator, then next TabItem will be located on the same row regardless on the value of its NextRow property.

member.summary: The keyboard shortcut to select this tab.

remarks.p: The access-key is the feature of a browser, which is triggered by the keyboard entry of Alt+key.
That property is supported only for InternetExplorer, which allows to set focus to the <TD> html element.

member.summary: Style object used to paint tab when it is in normal state (enabled, not selected and has no mouse)

remarks.p: The property of a particular tab has priority over that property.

This property is merged with the this.ControlStyle. It means that if the BackColor, ForeColor, Font, or sub-properties related to the border are not set, then values of corresponding properties of the this.ControlStyle are used.
When this property is set, then the reference to the original Style object remains the same, and Style-subproperties are copied using the Style.CopyFrom(...) method.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.UltraWebTab.ClientSideEvents
member.summary: The ClientSideEvents object maintains the names of JavaScript functions that are to be called on the client side in response to various events that can be processed there without the need for a server post-back.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.UltraWebTab.RoundedImage
member.summary: The RoundedImage object maintains properties related to rounded shape of tabs.

ul.li: To enable rounded images, the should be set to a value other than None.
To customize images the image related properties should be set, such as the

To customize images it is also possible to modify default images that are located at the
C:\Inetpub\wwwroot\aspnet_client\Infragistics\WebBars2\Images
Names of default images for a particular configuration of TabOrientation and TextOrientation appear within the property.
When this property is set, then the reference to the original RoundedImage object remains the same, and RoundedImage-subproperties are copied using the "RoundedImage.CopyFrom(...)" method.

member.summary: Directory in which the images used for the tabs are stored.

remarks.p: The string specified as the ImageDirectory will be prefixed onto the , , and properties of the object.
Note that is a particular file-image-name starts with the ".", "/", "\\" character or contains the ":" character, then that file-name will be used as it is without the ImageDirectory prefix.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.UltraWebTab.TabOrientation
member.summary: Location and alignment of the tabs relative to the .

remarks.p: Permitted values are: TopLeft, TopRight, BottomLeft, BottomRight, LeftTop, LeftBottom, RightTop, RightBottom

Each TabOrientation constant specifies the orientation and the alignment of the Tab objects when rendered. Eg., TopLeft indicates the Tabs will oriented on the Tab of the control and aligned to the left.

summary.p: Returns or sets the Orientation of the text within the

remarks.p: Permitted values are Horizontal and Vertical.

In all Netscape browsers and browsers prior to version 6.0 Vertical text indicates that the text will be rendered such that each letter is on a new line from top to bottom. On IE6 the text will be rotated 90 degrees clockwise.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.UltraWebTab.JavaScriptFileName
member.summary: Name of the file that contains the external JavaScript for client-side functionality on up-level browsers such as IE5, Netscape6.

remarks.p: Use this property to change the name of the external JavaScript file.
If value of this property is set to empty string, then the default value is used.
If value is 1-3 characters long, then dynamic client functionality becomes disabled, however, page is posted back on tab-click events.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.UltraWebTab.JavaScriptFileNameCommon
member.summary: Name of the file that contains the external JavaScript with common methods for client-side functionality on up-level browsers such as IE5, Netscape6.

remarks.p: Use this property to change the name of the common external JavaScript file.
If application uses any other instance of any Infragistics Web control, then values of that property in all controls should match, otherwise, client-side functionality in all controls may fail.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.UltraWebTab.BrowserTarget
member.summary: Type of browser the html should be created for.

remarks.p: Permitted values are DownLevel, UpLevel, and Auto.
The default value for this property is Auto which will detect the client browser and renders the output deemed appropriate for that browser.

member.summary: Index of the currently selected tab.

remarks.p: Note: Separators are skipped. Only tabs are considered. For example, if there is a separator between 1st and 2nd tabs and 2nd tab is selected, then this property will return value 1, but index of that TabItem within Tabs collection is equal to 2.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.UltraWebTab.SelectedTabIndex
member.summary: Index of the currently selected tab within TabItems.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.UltraWebTab.SelectedTabObject
member.summary: Reference to the currently selected tab.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.UltraWebTab.LoadAllTargetUrls
member.summary: Load all TargetUrls assigned to tabs at the time when page is loaded or keep loaded only one TargetUrl for the active/selected tab.

remarks.p:
In case of value true, all TargetUrls assigned to tabs are loaded and while dynamic navigation between tabs, the fields on tabs will keep old values. It means that if TargetUrl on one tab was modified and submitted to a server, then fields on another tab will not reflect those changes and contain old initial values.
In case of value true, only one TargetUrl which is assigned to active tab is loaded. If while navigation between tabs the previous TargetUrl was not submitted, then changes in fields on that TargetUrl become lost.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.UltraWebTab.CustomRules
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that determines additional CSS rules to apply to the ContentPane of the tabs.
member.p: This is available only for up-level browsers and the tag of html element to which rules are applied is <TD>.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.UltraWebTab.DummyTargetUrl
member.summary: Name of the dummy url that is used as the src for the IFRAME object when the TargetUrl of a Tab is not set.

remarks.p: Default value is set to the "dummy.htm".

If value is set to the empty string, then <IFRAME> elements are not written to html for tabs with empty TargetUrl. In this situation the client side function setTargetUrl is not available for those tabs.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.UltraWebTab.DynamicTabs
member.summary: Keep row with selected tab closest to the ContentPane.

remarks.p: This property has effect only when tabs are located in multiple rows. See and .

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.UltraWebTab.DisplayMode
member.summary: The appearance of tabs such as SingleRow/MultiRow/Scrollable for tabs with horizontal orientation. See .

remarks.p:
Notes:
Multi-row tabs are available only for horizontal orientation of tabs and they are not automatic: the property should be used.
Scrollable tabs are available only for horizontal orientation of tabs.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.UltraWebTab.SpaceOnRight
member.summary: Space between the right side of UltraWebTab and the right edge of the last Tab.

remarks.p:
Notes:
This property has effect only for TopRight, BottomRight, LeftBottom and RightBottom orientations of tabs. See .
This property has effect also when is set to the MultiRow and orientation of tabs is horizontal.
This property has no effect if the last TabItem (right edge) is instance of TabSeparator.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.UltraWebTab.SpaceOnLeft
member.summary: Space between the left side of UltraWebTab and the left edge of the first Tab.

remarks.p:
Notes:
This property has effect only for TopLeft, BottomLeft, LeftTop and RightTop orientations of tabs. See .
This property has no effect if the 1st TabItem (left edge) is instance of TabSeparator.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.UltraWebTab.FixedLayout
member.summary: Fixed or automatic layout of html-table that represents UltraWebTab control.

remarks.p:
Notes for the value of true:
The width of control is defined by the value of the Width property, and tabs on the right can become inaccessible until the is set to Scrollable.
Painting problems are possible if the Height of is not set or has too small value.
The scrollable behavior of every individual can be customized by the property.

summary.p: Set or gets a value that determines whether Section 508 compliant html will be emitted.

remarks.p: Section 508 compliance provides for support of assistive technologies that make html pages accessible for users that require it.

summary.p: The tab order of control.

remarks.p: That property is supported only for InternetExplorer, which allows to set focus to the <TD> html element.
When tab-order is enabled, then left/right arrows, Home and End keys become enabled as well.
When that property has its default value of 0, then the property will enable or disable tab-order features.
If property is set to a negative value, then tab-order functionality is disabled regardless of the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.UltraWebTab.AccessKey
member.summary: Keyboard shortcut used by control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebTab.UltraWebTab.StylePreset
member.summary: Configure appearance related properties using predefined values.

remarks.p: Note: The value of this property is not written to the ViewState and, therefore, it is not persistant between sessions. However, that property modifies many other (appearance related) properties, which are persistant between sessions if the ViewState is enabled. It means that if this property is set at run time, then it will result in significant increase of the size of the hidden-view-state-field which is passed to the client.
